title: Tides are not being provided for any locations other than North or South Carolina
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2021
content: I was asked to submit this review by Customer Service in an effort to accelerate the fix.  I am a daily user of Alexa, we live in a town near Atlantic City New Jersey, Ventnor NJ.  Every day we walk the beach, every morning awe ask Alexa what the High and Low tides are.  Recently we started getting a reply that says "Last Thursday, December 31st, the tides were...".  It appears that Alexa no longer has access to the tides, and Customer Service seemed to believe that the issue is related to this App  When I look at the App, it appears to be specific to the Carolinas.  Maybe Alexa is being directed there for all tide requests (?)

title: We have added over 3,000 locations!
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2022
content: We developed this 4 years ago because we live in Myrtle Beach and spend a lot of time on the beach. I see that several people are justifiably disappointed that this skill previously only gave tide times for my area (Myrtle Beach coastline).  We have added over 3,000 locations and have upgraded this skill to be more user friendly. If you have a specific location you'd like added, please email alexatidechart@gmail.com and we will do our best to make it happen. Thanks to everyone who enabled the skill.

title: less chatty please

title: This skill is not ready for roll out. Not a good skill as is.
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2018
content: I've waited a while for this skill, unfortunately it's not ready for roll out if you have multiple sensors and have multiple accounts. I use AcuRite everywhere, my summer house, my home and my elderly parents house. We are definitely power users with almost every kind of sensor they sell being used.That said, it is annoying to have to scroll through all devices to get to the one you want to hear conditions for. The senors are labeled, we should be able to ask for a specific one. Would also love to be able to switch between the 3 different accounts I have with AcuRite through Alexa. I currently follow all 3 accounts so they should at least allow us to monitor all accounts from our dashboard. Also do not like the fact it limits us to 7 devices. We have more than 7 with the ones outside and in multiple rooms just in our home base. Yes, we are using the old hub that handles more, as well as the new hub with the 7 device limit. They should recognize there are still people out there using the old hub.If you are using a wifi monitoring system like AcuRite, you probably set it up because you need something more than a regular thermometer. The Alexa skill should reflect the needs of your users and this just doesn't - hopefully yet.

title: It works, but could be a little better
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2019
content: It does announce the weater as expected,  but the really aggravating part is at the end of the weather conditions, it asks if you want to hear another. (this is for some that may have more than two stations i guess). I think it would be much better without this, something in the settings where you could toggle this on or off, im guessing most people only have one sensor/station anyway.One other thing that could be improved is the weather when played on a tv with a fire stick. It does show a text version of pretty much what the echo plays, but would be much better if there was an actual display along with the voice announcement, something resembling the icons showing on the weather station display.

title: I don't think much thought went into this
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2018
content: You can already get all of the information about outside conditions from Alexa so this skill is pretty much only useful to get that information the whole point of getting this system was so that you could get information about its many sensors I want to know the temperature in different rooms and the only way to do that with this skill just ask it about devices you have to listen to all the information about the outside weather that you probably already have up on a screen on another device and then you have to listen to them one at a time it's ridiculous they need to integrate it so that I can simply ask the echo what the temperature is at a particular sensor cuz that's all I really care about I don't really care about barometric pressure in different parts of my house or even the humidity why do they think people buy these things? I wouldn't buy it until they rethink this

title: Nice Weather Skill
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2020
content: I love the idea of gathering personal weather information without having to rely on a physical display.  I request this skill be developed to allow Alexa to provide custom notifications (i.e. lightning in the area, winds exceeding customized threshold, etc.).  AcuRite already has this feature to notify the user via email and text.  Please add a contact method to include built in Alexa device.

title: Skill works but cannot ask about a specific sensor
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2018
content: Because I have a number of sensors the skill is not very useful as one can only quickly get the initial 5-in-one weather station - listing all sensors just takes too long to be of use.

title: Needs more capabilities to initiate notifications to Alexa
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2018
content: I have too many Acurite sensors across to many buildings and am adding more.  Your system is wondering and I love it.  it allows me to monitor my vacation home, parents home and office easily via my iphone.The issue with the Alexa skills is that it doesn't push notifications.  I have a lot of sensors and quite frankly I can't remember all of the names and don't want to go down an entire list.  What is needed is for AcuRite and Alexa to be integrated to allow for notifications when alerts that I have set are triggered.Right now when Alexa has its normal blue right showing up as a yellow ring  I know I have a notification and simply ask Alexa for my 'notification'.  Right now that is done for arriving packages coming from Amazon.When an temperature or leak event that I have requested information about happens the Alexa unit should show the same notification ring color and be able to let me know what has triggered the notification, "Basement temperature went below 34 degrees."  It already sends me texts and emails so please just send me an Alexa notification also.There is an obvious chance that Alexa will not allow you to do that, but that is what your app needs.  It appears however that Amazon will allow it;Look here;  https://developer.amazon.com/docs/alexa-voice-service/notifications-overview.html

title: Need to be able to change phrase and have accurate location
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2021
content: So far everything seems to be working fine. connection was fine. You need to be able to update the Alexa skill phrase. The assigned one is ridiculous, you should be able to set the phrase to your device name. When functionality is updated my review will be adjusted accordingly.

title: Has Potential
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2018
content: Needs improvement in recognizing when the skill is being requested.  Most often when using the suggested text in the skill examples the response is "hmmm I don't know that one".  Some suggested use cases for broader application scope:  - Alexa notification ring if alarm condition is met (windchill, barometric pressure drop, heat index)  - Short term outlook (4, 8, 12 hour forecast)  - Options for summary, detail, forecast conditions  [Alexa, what is MyAcurite summary? What is MyAurite {8 hour, 4 hour, 12 hour} forecast? What is MyAcurite highs and lows today?]

title: Don't listen to the naysayers
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2019
content: Most of the reviewers for this skill are morons.  They don't know how to use it, and so call it stupid or redundant, etc.  I'm using it for lights in my house and it works flawlessly.  I have Alexa automatically turn on a lamp at sunset every day.

title: No way to add location and date in a routine
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020
content: You can add the Sunrise Sunset skill into a routine, but there is no way to set a city/location or day.  Thus, you must answer the skill every morning with the city, state and day before the skill will tell you the information you want.  Tedious.  It's easier just to ask Alexa every day "Alexa, ask Sunrise Sunset to get times in [city] [state] for [today]‚Äù  Plus for some reason, Alexa has a hard time understanding me when I go through the routine and Alexa rarely misunderstands me when the routine is not running.  This may not be a problem with Sunrise Sunset skill, but an Alexa issue.  I've never seen anyone else complain about that issue. If anyone knows how this is done, please let me know.

title: Useless
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2019
content: I want an Alexa skill to tuen my porch light on at sunset and off at sunrise. This is useless and Alexa doesn't have that skill that other already do.

title: Sunrise/Sunset
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2022
content: We live in the back of a cul-de-sac and there is not street light closeby, so we like for our garage lights and the two outsides by the garage door to be on at night time, and I always have to remember to turn the light switches on and off.  We added smart bulbs and connected them to Alexa.  We now use the sunrise/sunset routine and it works perfectly!  We don't have to touch the switches anymore.  Nice!

title: Amazon imposes unnecessary limitations on skill making it useless.
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2020
content: If you want 8.5 hours of darkness each night throughout the year, a good way is to turn lights out 8.5 hours before sunrise, and turn them back on at sunset.  This works great in the Pacific Northwest where the light cycles change drastically throughout the year. So exactly how does anyone benefit by such restrictions?  60 minutes plus or minus?  Is anyone creating use cases?

title: Its an integration not a device
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020
content: As with most smart home skills, the device associated with that service is now a recognized device in Alexa. Once a device, various trigger activities can be generated within the ecosystem of all Alexa devices, including annoucements of an event, like an open door, motion, etc. As IFTTT does not have permission for direct integration to trigger notifications in Alexa, there is no simple way to get Alexa to respond to an event with the WeatherFlow device, such as rain, or other events that might be important.

title: Best damn home station I ever owned
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2019
content: I own and; run a big farm, so I need to know weather, exactly and currently have several different weather stations up and running all at different locations about 3 or 400 feet from the main house. This weatherflow reporting is stellar and spot on and No matter what the cost, no natter how fast it sets up, or how rugged it is, It is not worth anything if the reporting is off or flawed.. This weatherflow station is perfect and exactly what the weather is outside. It works perfectly with my Alexa and internet.. I highly recommend this system to anyone who needs the real deal, and something that works when you are like us, out in the boonies, where TV weather has no clue.

title: Reprehensibly Lazy Skill Implementation
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2016
content: Hey, Amazon!!!Do you realize that SnoCountry has SPAMMED the Weather Skills category with 100's of instances of the SAME skill??? There are a ton of Weather Skills. Only a handful of these are NOT SnoCountry skills.Each version of the SnoCountry skill varies only by the ski resort being reported. That is insane. It's a waste of computing resources. Its a waste of storage on your own AWS servers. It's a waste of bandwidth. Its a waste of your customers' time looking for REAL weather skills. It's reprehensible.Those are some lazy programmers at SnoCountry - and even lazier skill reviewers at Amazon (those programmers had to write and replicate an Echo Skill.  All the reviewers had to say was "Aw, hell no!").Please recall this skill until SnoCountry releases a skill implementation with a single instance that's "smart" enough to understand a resort name when asked.P.S.: Please add a way to allot zero (0) stars. One star for this app is too generous.

title: Setting Default Location Gives Misleading Response
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2019
content: Ask Alexa "What time is high tide", and you will get a response based on Alexa's choice of location.  If you set a specific point as the new default, say for instance a favorite fishing spot, you still have to specify that exact location each time.  Who wants to have to say "Ask Tideguide what time is high tide in Plumb Beach Channel, NY? instead of simply "What time is high tide?"  every single time?  If you forget to say it that way, you will get the misleading information.  By the way, the information is inaccurate in both time and tidal height anyway, just close enough to be acceptable.  I'll stick to NOAA's website or the Tide Charts phone app by 7th Gear.

Example: Today April 17th Tide Guide states low tides are at "10:06 AM, 12:36 PM and 10:06 PM at elevations of 0.2, 0.2 and 0.1 feet". title: Solid Weather Skill. But, no information about premium pricing.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2019
content: I just read through paragraph after paragraph about the additional functionalities the premium subscription offers. But, nowhere does the developer provide pricing for the premium service on its Amazon page. Imagine any other Amazon product page that says everything and anything about a product but leaves out the cost! I eventually did some online searching and found that if I went to FAQ's one of the questions was, "How much does premium cost?" It's crazy to make customers go on such a wild goose chase for this information. Does the developer think that by not providing pricing information it will encourage more folks to sign-up for the premium service? Not this customer! Speaking of the premium experience, I was disappointed that "Snow" was not one of the offered notifications. Considering how few quality weather skills are available for Alexa (a glaring weakness in the platform), Big Sky will probably continue to thrive. But, I encourage the developer to prepare for the rainy days ahead when there is more competition in the weather skill arena. Be upfront about your product. Don't make customers search for the cost of your services.

title: Spammed with at least 1 ad every time i use it.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2018
content: If they don‚Äôt stop with the permium spam and other extra junk every time I use the skill, it is getting disabled for good. I don‚Äôt want to hear it talk for an extra minute when i occasionally ask big sky for the weather.

title: (UPDATE) I've been hijacked by Big Sky
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2022
content: Big Sky updated the ability to be removed as the default weather app.Now the sun is shining, the birds are chirping, the planets have all aligned and my Alexa and I are at one with the weather universe again.THANK YOU SO MUCH for addressing this issue.Big Sky is, once again, my favorite (hyper-local) app!  Upgraded back to my original 5 stars. Once you've ironed out some of the kinks (BigS as default but when I ask for hourly weather I get 7 day forecast, and playing nice with my Flash briefing I would consider making it the default a more permanent solution). Until then i am more than content with invoking BigSky for my detailed weather needs.Changed from 4 stars to 1.This skill WAS awesome. Yes, having to say "Alexa, Ask Big Sky...." was tedious, but it worked. Then on Jan 2, 2022, I was prompted to make Big Sky my default weather app by saying "Alexa, I prefer Big Sky for my weather updates.". I thought, "this would be great!". That was a command I now completely regret initiating to my poor, unsuspecting Alexa.Now:1. Daily Briefings no longer work correctly.2. Asking for the hourly weather makes Big Sky give me a seven day forecast.3. There is no "undo this horrible chaos" command I can give Alexa to free her from Big Sky's firm grip on the weather-verse. The only path to freedom was to completely disable Big Sky.I really hope they get this fixed. As much as I love the hyper-local weather Big Sky *did* deliver, I don't think they tested this enough to be ready for "prime time". At the very least their FAQ page (or the skill itself) should give instructions on how to undo this option instead of requiring a complete removal of the Big Sky skill. Oh and *if* you re-enable the skill, the mess starts all over again.So I am leaving the skill disabled until I can see on the FAQ or forums or a direct email from customer support (based on other posts, not holding my breath for this option) that they have this corrected.

title: WAS a Great skill, but...
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2018
content: One of the best skills offered by Alexa, until yesterday... This skill gives/gave the most detailed weather information and included sunrise/sunset times. Whereas this skill would give you forecast information for several days in advance when specifically requested, it now only tries to sell you a premium version when you ask for anything other than the current day's weather info.. The fee is not much at all, but if this is a sign of things to come, or a test to see if this will fly; I'd rather not step on that slippery slope.  One week ago, I would have given this 5 stars with a rave review, but I'll have to give only 3 until this is resolved. Though it is more detailed than the default weather report from Alexa, at least the default weather skill will give you a 7-day forecast.

title: Transparency of charges to your account

title: Nobody and nothing is 100% perfect

title: Good skill but ...

title: SNOW REPORT issue solved
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2016
content: Linked it via the web site. Enabled it. All setup went fine, no issues. But no matter what I try, when I do "alexa, open Big Sky" I hear the forecast for Big Sky Ski resort. UPDATE - SOLVED (and reproducible). If you use voice controls to enable "Big Sky" you get the Big Sky resort snow report. Even if you then use the web site or app to add Big Sky Weather, you can only get the snow report. To fix, disable the snow report skill. To avoid issue in the first place, enable Big Sky weather via the web site or app, not using your voice.And, now that I can use it, Big Sky weather is fairly great.

title: GREAT SKILL, But STILL JUST THE BARE FACTS!
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2017
content: I loved Alexa's weather information on my Amazon Dot because it was simple and to the point; unlike the TV weather.  However, there were times I needed just a little bit more information on a given day; particularly specifics about the rain or snow.  I would usually follow up the weather on the Dot by checking the 'Dark Skies' app on my phone on those particular days.  NOW, with BIG SKY on my Dot, I can just ask Alexa for 'the weather' or 'Big Sky' and not have to follow up on either with anything else.  'Big Sky 'has just the right information, including special Weather Warnings and Statements that you can ask for additionally, but without all the references to what the weather is doing in some other part of the country, or even the state, and how it will impact my area 'maybe' in a day or a week.  No fronts, depressions, etc. Weather reporting is barely accurate on a daily basis, much less a week ahead of time.  That being said, I would sometimes like tomorrow's projected weather on' Big Sky'.'  Tomorrow's weather, indeed a week's worth of weather, IS available on the 'Dark Sky' app and you can ask Alexa for tomorrow's, or even next weekend's, weather anytime.  There may be a way to get tomorrow's weather on 'Big Sky' on my Dot; but I either am overlooking that information or it hasn't be described to me how to ask Dot for it.  Anyone know the details?  If so, please leave a comment enlightening me.Otherwise, if you like straightforward weather that includes a few more details than Alexa's streamlined weather I highly recommend thie 'Big Sky' skill.

title: Love Big Sky with reservations...
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2018
content: I love that Big Sky gives a CONCISE report with an option for more detailed info. What I hate is that it was giving us "notifications" and "weather alerts" for Albuquerque, NM... which is an hour south of us, a lower elevation than Santa Fe, and whose weather is not remotely similar to ours. We would be sleeping at 3 AM when these "alerts" would be announced in our bedroom! I eventually learned how to shut off these irrelevant "alerts". But we both lost lots of sleep hearing about the weather in Albuquerque, NM! There was no warning that Santa Fe would get snow last night... only that Albuquerque (!) might get freezing temperatures. Thank goodness it doesn't tell us that it'll be hot and humid in Florida or cold in Alaska!

title: Detail where it's use

title: I‚Äôm not experincing issues others report

I haven‚Äôt used Flash Briefing for a few months. That is a big miss if it has been dropped but you can add other weather skills to Flash Briefing.Personally, I don‚Äôt see a reason why a person rates Big Sky with one star simply because it doesn‚Äôt integrate with Flash Briefing. title: Too many bothersome lengthy ads
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2020
content: I would only get weather info about half the time.  The rest of the time I had to wait through long bothersome ads for the premium version I don't want. I would say "Open Dark Sky" expecting to at least eventually get detailed weather information as I got ready to leave for work or make outdoor plans -- But all I would get is an aggravating advertisement for the premium version of the app.  Seriously, only the plug for the premium version and not even any weather info.  The developers don't even reward you for slogging through their ad by giving you what you asked for.  It would run through a pitch for the premium version and then end with "Would you like to active Dark Sky Premium?" So even after waiting for the pitch to finish you still don't get the information you wanted in the first place.  This renders the app completely useless a significant percentage of the time. This eventually got so frustrating that I disabled it completely and if I could uninstall it I would do so.  It's not worth the headache, the juice isn't worth the squeeze.  I understand that the authors want to make some money but the way they're going about it is the surest way I can think of to get people to abandon their product completely.  There's a lot of weather services out there, you're probably not going to think this one is so good that you can't live without the premium version and you're probably going to get sick of the sales pitches like I did.This betrays a lack of understanding of basic marketing.  Rather than encourage people to stay with the product and hope they eventually see the advantages of the paid premium version they are bludgeoning people with their premium version ads and driving them out of contact with the product completely. Every time someone launches Dark Sky there's a hope and a chance they might find enough value in it to pay for the premium version but for someone like me who has been driven away from the product in frustration there's no chance at all.  Exposure goes to zero and there's not even a chance that I would use it in front of a friend or acquaintance who might become interested.  This is a recipe for failure.

title: A great set of additional weather features
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2021
content: Overall, I love this skill. Big Sky's answers to weather related questions are useful mini weather reports. This skill is definitely worth using if you want a little more than default answers for weather related questions. The only issues I've had with this skill have been around it capturing normal commands Alexa should handle. While asking for this skill to give the weather, I asked for Alexa to increase volume. Instead of doing so, the skill announced that it was changing my scale from Fahrenheit to Celsius.

title: I'm about ready to disable this application
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2019
content: Here's a typical session:Me: (notices there's a notification) Alexa, what are my notifications?Alexa: You have one notification: A small craft advisory is in effect. To hear more, tell Alexa to ask Big Sky what are my notifications.(The advisory should be a Wind Advisory or Winter Storm Warning or something applicable to land.)Me: Alexa, ask Big Sky what are my notifications?Alexa: Your locations are I have sent a card to the Alexa app. To get your notifications, set your location inside the Alexa app.Me: (inarticulate howling noise as I set up my locations, yet again)Lather, rinse, repeat.I have gone through this too many times to count. I activated this skill because I wanted the NWS advisories, but so far that function has been practically useless to me. Unless something improves and improves soon, I'm going to uninstall the skill and drop the review down to one star. I am giving it three stars now because it does what it does adequately; I just wish it would do what I really want it to.

title: This should be built-in!

title: So much superior information in an inferior skill
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2018
content: This app gives so much information which is great. Humidity, barometric pressure, wind speed, etc.  However, on the Echo Show, it only displays a fraction of that information even though it speaks all of it. Plus, it has what data it displays on the right side of the screen and you have to swipe to scroll to see it all. But!  when you swipe, Alexa stops talking. Very frustrating.The most frustrating part is the premium subscription. Great price at less than $2/year, but it‚Äôs not even worth that. I‚Äôve had to sign up for it 3 times until it finally worked. Then, it lets you set 4 labeled locations with only 1 line for the address.  Not sure what format is required for it to recognize the address, but there‚Äôs no way for me to try again when the 2 I added didn‚Äôt work. That screen is not in the skill settings, so the only way to add or change an address is to delete the skill and sign up all over again. That‚Äôs just not acceptable for one of the Alexa Skill store‚Äôs featured skills.

title: Big Sky is a Great Weather App!!!
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2018
content: For some time we have been looking for a reliable and accurate weather service, and we believe we found one, Big Sky Premium.Not only does it provide a complete weather forecast, you can ask for additional details and alerts. It also provides the user with many useful options. The one we like is the ability to reference four additional locations by name as well as our own and get the complete forecasts for current day, the weekend or seven day projection.  Initially we had questions and sent them to Steve, the developer of the program.  He answered our email almost immediately and provided us with complete and easy to understand explanations.We cannot say enough good things about Big Sky Premium and without hesitation we endorse the program and have recommended it to many others.  Try it, you will be impressed too.

content: It says it is raining right now. It is not, the closest radar hit is about 150 miles away. It also says there is a 100% chance of rain today. It is not raining now and every other weather source I have says otherwise (to include dark sky.) This is not the first time this has happened with Big Sky. I was also awakened by the yellow notification on my dot (yes, I know it can be turned on and off) for a wind advisory. If there was a tornado coming, that's one thing, for Gusty winds late in the afternoon it's another. Especially at 3am. Maybe I'll try this out in a few months. For now, it needs some work.

title: Beware of Idiots Leaving Negative Reviews
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2019
content: This skill is FANTASTIC! It gives a very detailed forecast, if you like that sort of thing, or a more basic one for those who want just the ‚Äúhighlights‚Äù. It notifies you of any weather watches or advisories currently applicable to your specific location. It also gives the seven day forecast if you ask it too. You can get the forecast for a specific time of day as well. It‚Äôs a great skill to have with Alexa for those of us in areas prone to severe weather.Be aware of some leaving negative reviews based on their own personal error(s) while using/setting up the skill. It absolutely measures temps in C and F. You just have to tell it which you prefer when linking your account. Of course some fool gave it a negative review based on their belief it doesn‚Äôt measure in anything other than Farenheit. Some people are utterly stupid and shouldn‚Äôt be permitted to leave reviews. üôÑ

title: Spanglish
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2022
content: Shortly after I added Alexa's bilingual feature--meaning we can talk to it in either Spanish or English, Big Sky began reporting in neither and both; Spanglish. It would speak in a heavy Spanish accent and say something like, "The high today will be sesenta y siete, and the low tonight will be cuarenta y cuatro." So it isn't accessible to someone who speaks only Spanish or English, you have to know both. What were they thinking? I removed Big Sky and went back to Alexa's more limited weather reports, because you can ask in Spanish and it answers in Spanish, or ask in English and get an answer in English.

title: It was a great app - until it hijacked my weather and broke my routines
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2022
content: This was a great app until about 2 weeks ago (March 2022), just say 'Alexa, ask Big Sky for the weather' and you would get your detailed weather. If you wanted something shorter OR IF YOU WANT TO GET THE WEATHER IN A ROUTINE, then 'Alexa, what's the weather' worked just fine for a brief overview. However, I now get Big Sky no matter how I ask for the weather, and IT BROKE ALL MY ROUTINES with weather in them because it starts up Big Sky which ends the routine. You can, I suppose, put the weather last. But that's not where I want it, and it also means I can not ask for my package statuses (which must be last in a routine). Boo and hiss. I've Googled and tried pretty much everything to no avail. I ended up deleting the Big Sky app - now I get the original weather and all my routines are working again. But if I re-install Big Sky, it just hijacks everything again.

title: Too bad you can't give negative stars.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2020
content: I just recieved my new Echo Dot and decided to ask about Hurricanes because Hurricane Eta is headed my way (November 11th, 2020).  It doesn't recognize Eta and keeps asking if I information Charley, Katrina, etc.  So I give up on Eta and follow Alexa's recommendation to get information on current storms ... great ... then it lists the date of October 12th and proceeds to rattle off information on Hurricane Delta.Hurricanes are very destructive and life threatening so this no joke guys, pull your heads out of your asses and get it right.  Hurricane information is update EVERY SINGLE HOUR ON THE HOUR!  What's next?  You ask Alexa to call 9-1-1 and it recites the historical events and impact of 9/11 or simply replies "Nine One One is September eleventh and is a date in history when terrorists attacked the United States.  Here is a list of movies and books."  It might be time to replace a clay pidgeon with an Amazon Echo Dot ... PULL!

title: Useful and Funny!
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2021
content: I love that this feature was both useful and funny. I was confused about why it would be a skill you needed to add until i used it. You could always ask this question before but it wouldn't have come up with a witty or snarky response.  For those that are complaining about language; but not only does it warn you about the language, it's your own fault for not turning on the setting that blocks offensive word use (or for turning it off because the default setting is on). This would be under either the main settings or your profile tab, I don't recall which. I also believe that there's a separate setting for the phone app, and Alexa device, although you can probably just tell your Alexa device: Alexa, always block offensive language please. Regardless, crotch goblin person said it best... unless you happen to live in Utah where bad words (I'm using bad sarcastically, but the review refuses to allow me to use quotations) will make a crowd of people turn and look at you like you have 3 heads and/or grown a nice pair of leathery wings.

It seems these days everybody is getting all butt hurt about every little thing. Get over it.

title: Almost a Good Skill
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2019
content: I've been using this on my phone, comp and tablet for years so When I saw that there was a skill for Echo Show, I was elated...then I opened It and was deflated. It was just a static image with no zoom capabilities and showed the entire U.S. so I stopped using the skill until I opened it again today and saw that they listened to the people's suggestions and was again happy until I tried to look at the radar  through the big gray current weather window and Zoom buttons that never go away. I tried to click on the map behind them to see if that would make them disappear but Nope...it didn't. When they make it so that the map is the only thing on the screen and I can Pinch Zoom in and out, it will be the perfect skill. I have no doubts that they will fix it as they are really good at listening to and addressing the customer's complaints and/or suggestions. One last thing, if you could make the map stay on the screen until I make it go back home, that would be great because a lot of times when the weather is bad I open this app on my Tablet, computer or phone and leave it on so I can keep an eye on it until the bad weather has passed which can be hours. Once these things are changed I will update and change my review and rating.

title: WILL NOT DISPLAY RADAR WHEN USING ALEXA APP FOR WINDOWS
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2020
content: This seems to be a trend with most skills I've come across... But the Alexa for windows app will not display radar when using the voice command "Alexa, ask MyRadar to show me the radar."I have the MyRadar app installed on multiple devices including my phone, a FireTV stick, and my windows 10 PC.When using said voice command on my phone or FireTV stick, radar is displayed... However, when using said voice command on the Alexa app for windows she responds "Radar display is not supported on this device, please try another request."Considering all that's needed here is a display screen... and obviously my PC has one... Why has the skill developer not allowed this function to work through the Alexa app for windows?And before you ask... Yes, I have discussed this trend with Amazon's Alexa support team. They are stating it is the duty of the skill developer to enable these features.Same trending issue with Arlo skill. Alexa app for windows states "Sorry, cameras don't work on this device." when using the voice command "Alexa, show me the front door." (this function works properly on both my phone and FireTV stick)

title: Show skill broke the Fire TV app!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2018
content: I have been using the MyRadar app for Fire TV for years. It lacks the (minimal and generally poor) forecast, and other bells and whistles of the Android version, but looks better on a bigger screen, especially with the wind layer enabled. It also added Alexa voice integration when that rolled out to FireTV in 2016, allowing me to launch it just by saying, "Alexa, open My Radar," and even play/pause the loop animation with voice commands.  Once the skill for Echo Show came out, however, all that awesomeness went away.  Play/pause via voice is completely gone, and to launch it now, you need to say, "Alexa, open My Radar on Fire TV," and sometimes that doesn't even work.  I don't have an Echo Show, so why is this skill even available to other Echo devices? All it does is break their previously great (and free/ad-free, BTW) Fire TV app.

title: Good, but ..... want to see the radar not current conditions
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2022
content: It's a nice app to show the weather radar, but it also displays a current conditions window box that blocks HALF the radar screen image.  Really dumb - here's why:  For us on the east US coast, putting a window of current conditions on the left side of the radar map screen blocks what's coming to us from the west (normal weather flow) and shows mostly the ocean to the east on the right side.  PLEASE give an option to disable current conditions window within the app as it's not the reason why we want myradar -- we want to see the radar image for our area.  We already know the current conditions!

title: Allmost .........................................
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2021
content: The app itself works well, but the commands are terrible. I got this app to see the local weather radar. You would think "alexa, my radar" would do that ... but you must say "alexa, ask my radar to show me the radar". I'm retired, I can't even remember that long a phrase !! I may have to stick a post it note to the screen to remember. After all we got the app to see a radar picture, that's where I want to go directly! After I'm at the radar screen, I can always ask for other weather data. Also it would be very nice if you could choose how long you want the radar screen to persist and if it would remember the last zoom setting.

title: when it works?!

content: Needs a lot of improvment. My biggest complaint is its very unreliable. Alexa is constantly unable to open skill. But when it works its great. title: Like this skill so far, except for the intro monologue
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2021
content: Just got an Echo Show 8 and am enjoying this app.  Very useful for watching the bands of weather rolling in as they tend to do in my area.I would love to have a "quiet start" option added to this skill, so when it starts up it goes straight to the radar screen without the long monologue of weather information.  I assume it was written for the non-show devices, but it isn't needed on the shows.  I want to use this in the morning to check the weather, but the long (30+ second) monologue disturbs my family.

title: Echo Show 8, has zoom
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
content: I noticed a lot of reviews complained about no zoom, it is obvious that the developers listened. Just enabled this skill, and promptly got a display of thunderboomers all around me in central Texas. I asked it to first zoom in to Austin, it did, so then I said zoom in to Lago Vista, Texas and it did that as well.  Initially I was put off because Alexa displayed bars for temperature and such, obscuring the radar view behind but after 5 seconds or so they went away and only the radar from NOAA was showing.  Just got curious as I was typing this, told Alexa, "Myradar for Miami, Florida, and it did. Showed the hurricane on approach, and Alexa offered to zoom in or out, so I said, "Zoom out", and darn if it didn't show me the radar down towards cuba!  Nothing to gripe about, other than the default for displaying is about 10 or 15 seconds and then it goes off.  Hence the pathetic 4 stars instead of 5.  :)

title: Gives the currect info..
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2020
content: One would think with the Alexa platform being so "powerful" and essential to the home, Amazon would integrate Emergency Broadcast Service and data from n.o.a.a..  At first flash briefing request it just faded out, nothing.. I waited a minute and asked again [I have no other items on my flashb..btw] It did start up with the information... Going over the progress of Nana over Belize. .. A few things for your consideration if you're going to use it..NO settings.. and at times the talking speed is over-whelming, It's no weather channel report.. It is 'nice' to have all the data, but if it can not be heard or trimmed down to just the "when/where/is my butt in trouble'' information it looses attention quick.. [But kudo's to the dev, for utilizing the available information!]The important information does come at Ya first.. then it gets wordy. There are times that the Alexa routine shows it's infancy.. when "mb'' came up in the info, it was read as "megabytes" not millibars as intended..

title: Finally a fix for weather alert location!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2022
content: My echo was giving me weather alerts for my old location in another state even though all my Alexa device locations were set to new location. Thank you Kevin Willbur for posting the solution to fix this; simply ask Alexa to "turn off weather alerts". Alexa will then say something along the lines of: "weather alerts for [old location] stopped". Then, if you want, tell Alexa to "turn on weather alerts" and Alexa will then give alerts for current location. I wish Alexa would ask, after you update the device location, if you'd like to change this alert but unfortunately she does not. This was driving me nuts and is finally fixed. Thanks Kevin!

title: FINALLY got location to update
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2022
content: I‚Äôve been trying to figure out how to update our location for over a year. So THANK YOU to the last reviewer, because their suggestions worked for me. Might seem obvious, but just in case - first, you have to be on the phone of the account holder for the Echo. A subsidiary account member will not work to override the settings. Once I was on the account owner‚Äôs phone and in the Alexa app, I went to Devices - All Devices - Alexa on this Phone. Changing that one address under Alexa on this Phone was the only one that mattered - none of the other addresses I‚Äôve changed on either of our phones anywhere in the Alexa app fixed the issue. Hope this helps someone else who has been losing their mind over weather alerts from a town they left because they hated everyone there. Amazon, ruining my weather alerts since 2020.

title: Check your settings if you are getting incorrect weather reports
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2017
content: If you are having trouble getting the wrong weather reports, go into your Alexa app (or to Alexa.Amazon.com), click on the box in the upper left hand corner, go into Settings > (choose your device) > then set up your device location, time zone, and desired temperature units.  You should then get the correct information.

title: Limited Info, not too reliable.
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2018
content: I don‚Äôt know exactly where she gets her stats from, but I‚Äôm guessing it must be on the farthest opposite edge of town. The current temp is fairly reliable, but dont ask much more or she‚Äôll frustrate more than facilitate. Ie: ‚ÄúAlexa, what‚Äôs the heat index?‚Äù -‚ÄúHeat index is defined as...‚Äù Or, ‚ÄúWill it rain today?‚Äù -‚ÄúNo rain is expected today, there‚Äôs only a 70% chance.‚Äù (Huh? Btw, it‚Äôs been pouring outside for 3 hours). I wish she‚Äôd gps the location she‚Äôs at and learn a bit more like the dew point, humidity, heat index, etc. and also be able to tell me what the weather will be at 11:00 rather than the vague all-day forecast. Also don‚Äôt like asking questions just to get the same forecast repeated over and over. I‚Äôd also like to be able to make ‚Äútoday‚Äù anytime after my am alarm and before the next one. Asking what the weather will be tomorrow and getting wrong info bc it‚Äôs 12:30 am happens all the time.

title: Works for me.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2017
content: Works well for me. For those that are having trouble you need to set at a minimum the zip code where the device is installed. You do this from within the Alexa app. Go to Settings -->> Devices -->> then click on the device you want to configure. If you have more than one then you'll need to set this for each one I believe. After you select the individual device, scroll down to the General section and you should see a sub-section titled Device Location with the description that this location will be used for weather and other local features. You can also set your time zone.

content: Forecasts are reasonably accurate; however, it doesn't shut up about things I didn't ask for.When I simply ask for the current temperature, I don't need to hear about tonight's forecast and tomorrow's forecast.Worse yet, is not being able to fine tune it to shut up about weather alerts!  Where I live, during spring time, we are in a never ending flood watch and it means nothing to anyone.  Ask for the temperature and it'll start off with its flood warning spiel including the day, date and time it expires...which it never does because it just gets extended.This would be like having to listen to a detailed heat advisory alert during the months of June, July and August in Arizona.

title: Text-to-speech programming could use some work
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2017
content: It does read the weather. However, you have to listen closely so that you can translate Alexa's speech to normal English. For instance, she gives me the weather for Atlanta, GA but pronounces the state abbreviation as "gah." Sure, it's not the end of the world but you'd think that the text-to-speech programming would have included the fifty states' and the territories' abbreviations so it wouldn't throw the listener for a loop. Here, it's kind of funny to have her say "Atlanta...GAH!!!" like she's frustrated with Atlanta but it might not be so funny elsewhere. Although in Hawaii, you'd have a friendly weather report: "Honolulu...Hi!!"

title: Make sure you have the right settings
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2016
content: Good way for me to check the weather on the go. If you're wondering why Alexa says it's 25° when its really 80° make sure your settings do not have metric settings on. Just go to Settings > (your) Echo Dot > scroll down to where it has the conversion options and make sure metric conversions for temperature is turned off.

title: Works well for me
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2021
content: I love to get a weather forecast each morning when I wake up, and I'm not particularly fond of the default weather. I run Weatherbug on my computers, so I thought I'd enable it on Alexa as well. I configured my default location with ease and it remembered the location each time. It does what I expect -- it gives me a weather brief when I ask for the forecast, but I can also ask for an extended forecast (etc) and it will supply it. The current temp is accurate for my location, the forecast good... so I'm happy.

title: Doesn't work
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2018
content: As usual another skill that doesn't work.  As soon as Google adds a hub to their device as echo plus has, I will be switching over to them.  Much more intuigive, finds more information, can answer more questions and doesn't have a bunch of useless skills that don't work anyway.  This is the second or third weather skill I tried to enable today as the AccuWeather skill is a day behind in it's forecast....and none of them have worked.  All send some type of error message.  Is this intentional so only AccuWeather gets used?  R they partners so they make sure other weather skills don't work or are these weather skill companies just unable to make smart skills to work correctly?

I also disabled and enabled the app twice but received the same problem, wrong weather report and NO forecast.  Going to try a different app.

title: good, but could use some tweaks
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2017
content: First, and the reason it's 4 star instead of 5, is that at 9am, it gives the current weather, then tonights, but skips the early afternoon information.  Would be better if it gave current, Then all the info for the day, even if partly into it.  Second, is that this should really be able to be included in my news briefing so I can hear it with my news AND ask for it later if I want.And the one thing that it is really missing, is being able to give tomorrow's weather.

title: Aviation Weather works great.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2017
content: Just enabled this skill on my Amazon TAP and it works perfectly.  Tried several airports and it has gotten it right every time.  I also asked it to find a METAR for KDLC, which does not have AWOS, and the TAP told me correctly that she was unable to find a METAR for that airport.  .

title: Almost there!!!
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2016
content: It is almost great.....almost.First off, cool concept & bravo to the developer. It's pretty cool to ask Alexa for my METAR when I wake up to see what the weather is at the airport.Just a couple of suggestions, and I don't know if they're possible, but would be nice of they could be implemented. First, is it possible to get Alexa to recognize the phonetic alphabet? I have tried over a dozen times to get the weather for KCXP, and she always replies that she can't find a METAR for KCXC. She hears KMEV correctly, but seems to have an issue with P. Second, is there a way to pause for a second between elements? It is awesome that she gives the measurements in different units (SM / KM) but I find I have to listen a few times because she'll go through too quickly.Otherwise, very cool skill! Thank you!

title: Needs much more developement
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2018

title: No phonetic alphabet support
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2016
content: No phonetic alphabet support. This means that KVUO results in kbuo or something altogether different. Any pilot knows the phonetic alphabet. Why not add support for it? Kilo Victor Uniform Oscar is allot easier for Alexa to recognize than KVUO.In short, add photenic alpababet support and this skill would prove useful to many.

date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2017
content: It works great for me! To anyone that the app isn't working for, please make sure that you have your home address and postal code entered into your device's settings, and also make sure that you give the Humidity skill permission to access that information in order for it to work.

content: I have NMO- neuromyelitis optica. The humidity effect my hour by hour moblity. high hum. = high inflammation not able to move, low hum. = less inflam. = more moblity. So for me knowing the hum. is imperative. Thanks to however made this skill.

title: Simple and straight forward info from my Davis station.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2022
content: Very clean way to get data from my Davis weather Station.  This is still a work in progress but it is nice to just get just what you need verbally.  I understand that there is some work in progress to be able to display info on a Show device. I am looking forward to this.

title: Fiinally someone using the Ecowitt API
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2022
content: This is the only skill I'm aware of that uses the Ecowitt API to get the data directly from your personal weather station. The developer deserves your support on their Patreon.

title: Flawed but still best wind info on Alexa right now.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2016
content: This is the best wind app in Alexa right now including default, but it's not perfect. It's limited to certain cities, requires some careful practice to get the date and city you want consistenly. And - it doesn't give you the wind speed now, just the forecast. That said it's a lot better than nothing and the forecasts are accurate.

title: Usless
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2017
content: I live in Rhode Island. The nearest covered city seems to be Boston. Not representative of Narragansett Bay where I sail.Telling me the wind "high" is 10mph with no direction and no trend is really useless.We need marine forecasts for coastal communities. Opportunity here for someone.
